00053 /** Maximum size of any memory file (1MB). **/
00054 #define MAX_MEMORY_SIZE     1048576

00056 /** Baudrate to use for slow devices **/
00057 #define SLOW_BAUDRATE       9600

00063  * Sets the maximum number of errors that will be printed by the verification
00064  * process before quitting. 0 = infinite
00065  **/

00068 /** String in FTDI EEPROM on 25mm programming boards. **/

00071 /** String in FTDI EEPROM on 10mm programming boards. **/
00072 #define DESC_10MM_PROG      "Tyndall 10mm Interface"

00079 /**
00080  * Returns bit vector e.g. @c BV(2) is 00000010.
00081  * @param bit number of places to shift bit left.
00082  **/
00083 #define BV(bit)    (1 << (bit))
00084 
00085 
00086 /**
00087  * Strips the path from a file location string.
00088  *
00089  * @param pathString filename including path.
00090  * @return pointer to filename within @c pathString.
00091  **/
00092 static inline const char* stripPath(const char* pathString)
00093 {
00094     const char* filename;
00095 
00096     /* Strip the path (everything upto and including last '/' or '\') */
00097     for (filename = pathString; *pathString != '\0'; pathString++) {
00098         if (*pathString == '\\' || *pathString == '/') {
00099             filename = pathString + 1;
00100         }
00101     }
00102     return filename;
00103 }
00104 
00105 
00106 /**
00107  * Returns high byte of a two byte integer.
00108  *
00109  * @param word input word.
00110  * @return high byte.
00111  **/
00112 static inline uint8_t getHighByte(uint16_t word)
00113 {
00114     return (uint8_t)(word >> 8);
00115 }
00116 
00117 /** Returns low byte of a two byte integer.
00118  *
00119  * @param word input word.
00120  * @return low byte.
00121  **/
00122 static inline uint8_t getLowByte(uint16_t word)
00123 {
00124     return (uint8_t)word;
00125 }
00126 
00127 /**
00128  * Delays for a number of milliseconds.
00129  *
00130  * @param delay how many milliseconds to delay.
00131  **/
00132 static inline void sleep_ms(uint32_t delay)
00133 {
00134 #ifdef __WIN32__
00135     Sleep(delay);
00136 #else
00137 #warning "Delay code for non win32 platforms is not tested!"
00138     struct timespec nanoDelay, remainingDelay;
00139     nanoDelay.tv_sec = delay / 1000;
00140     delay = delay % 1000;
00141     nanoDelay.tv_nsec = delay * 1e6;
00142     while (-1 == nanosleep(&nanoDelay, &remainingDelay)) {
00143         nanoDelay = remainingDelay;
00144     }
00145 #endif
00146 }
00147

00149 /** Different types of memory that can be programmed. **/
00150 typedef enum {
00151     MEM_NRF9E5 = 1, MEM_ATMEGA_FLASH, MEM_ATMEGA_EEPROM, MEM_ATMEGA_FUSES
00152 } memType_t;
00153 
00154 
00155 /**
00156  * Structure for describing the SPI device with a description string and
00157  * bitmasks for each of the pins.
00158  **/
00159 typedef struct {
00160     char description[64];   /**< Description string. **/
00161     uint8_t ncs;      /**< Active low Chip Select. **/
00162     uint8_t sck;      /**< Serial Clock. **/
00163     uint8_t miso;     /**< data: Master In, Slave Out. **/
00164     uint8_t mosi;     /**< data: Master Out, Slave In. **/
00165     uint32_t baudRate;  /**< Baud rate of communications. **/
00166     uint32_t memorySize;      /**< Total size of memory, in bytes. **/
00167     uint32_t codeSize;        /**< Size of memory that can be used for code. **/
00168 
00169     /**
00170      * When supporting reprogramming, there will be large gaps in the code. This
00171      * array stores addresses, where data should be written. There can be 4
00172      * different writes, and the start address, and write count is stored.
00173      **/
00174     uint32_t writeAdds[4][2];
00175 
00176     /** Function programs bytes to the memory memory (data, address, size). **/
00177     void (*write)(const uint8_t*, uint32_t, uint32_t);
00178 
00179     /** Function reads bytes from the memory (data, address, size). **/
00180     void (*read)(uint8_t*, uint32_t, uint32_t);
00181 
00182     /** Function erases all data in the memory. **/
00183     void (*erase)(void);
00184 
00185     /** Function adds header info to code (data, size, isSupportReprog). **/
00186     void (*addHeader)(uint8_t*, uint32_t, bool);
00187 } spiDeviceInfo_t;
00188 
00189 
00190 #endif
